page.title: 04Blandford-Downwood Vineyard
page.content: Mr & Mrs Hall grow 3 kinds of grapes. They are Madeleine Angevine and Madeleine Sylvaner and they have one row of Chardonnay. Mrs Hall took us through the wood along a primrose walk. They think they have a badger in the wood. We saw some wild roses. We saw pheasant as well. There are beech,ash,bramble,nut trees and lots of lovely wild flowers. Right at the top of their property you can just see Blandford Camp. The pests in the vineyards are moles which make big mole hills & snails which eat the vine leaves. Deer & rabbits also eat and spoil the growing vines. Wasps & birds eat the grapes. On the by-pass and in the newly disturbed earth there are lots & lots of red poppies. There are even some purple poppies. Mr Hall is a pilot for British Airways flying a Jumbo Jet 747 from Heathrow airport.
